author: John Cross
title: Gareth Southgate eyes three-man defence against Germany with Michael Keane set for England debut
text:
Get daily     
Gareth Southgate is planning to use a back three experiment against Germany . 
England boss Southgate will use Gary Cahill, Michael Keane and Chris Smalling as his three centre halves as the tactical system for the friendly in Dortmund. 
Chelsea defender Cahill, who will captain England, has been playing in that formation to great success under Antonio Conte this season. 
Southgate also played in that system during his England days under Terry Venables and clearly wants to try it. 
Kyle Walker and Ryan Bertrand are the wing backs while Southgate has named a strong team even with Sunday's World Cup qualifier with Lithuania on Sunday. Southgate will look to replicate England's win in Berlin last year (Photo: Getty) 
There is a surprise start for West Brom's Jake Livermore. Southgate hinted he was ready to experiment with a back three at his pre-match press conference. Southgate is handing Jake Livermore a start (Photo: The FA via Getty) 
Southgate said: "We’ve got to be open minded to anything. The best teams I played in with England we had tactical flexibility so I think the game is more and more…. pressing in different ways, playing out from the back in different ways, more 1v1 defending, teams are brave in the way they defend to get on the front foot. 
"There is a lot of decision making for players and one of the keys for us is to have players who are going to make decisions and good decisions under pressure.” England team to face Germany
